overview_of_class: This course is designed to teach you the basics of single variable calculus, probability, set theory, random variables, and hypothesis testing. The course prepares students for the next class in the statistics sequence: 405, Linear Models. The fundamentals of this course will be covered in a review course prior to the start of the quarter.
name: Introduction to Probability and Statistics
title: WCAS POLI_SCI 403-0-20 Introduction to Probability and Statistics
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Graduate Students.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is designed to teach you the basics of single variable calculus, probability, set theory, random variables, and hypothesis testing. The course prepares students for the next class in the statistics sequence: 405, Linear Models. The fundamentals of this course will be covered in a review course prior to the start of the quarter.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Understand relationship between calculus and probability (PDF, CDF), conduct tests on measures of association, conduct hypothesis tests

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: "Statistical Methods for the Social Sciences" Students may select either the 5th edition (Agresti) or 4th edition (Agresti & Finlay)

subject: POLI_SCI
